intro: Acrostichum angulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of the Americas, particularly Central and South America. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, preferring moist, sandy soils. Acrostichum angulatum is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and unique floral display.
